Issues.Title: test: add an internal helper to populate document.head before a test
Issues.Body:
This commit reuses the logic of the `withBody` helper and implements the `withHead` based on it.The helper method is useful for tests that rely on a certain tags being present in document's `<head>` element.

This need was caused by the logic in the `NgOptimizedImage` directive in the #46053. The newly added function is an internal helper (not a public API).

Issues.Body:

forms

Issues.Title: docs: change wrong alerts to callouts
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

In the aio docs there are some alerts with headers but alerts don't support headers (see the [docs style guide - alerts and callouts](https://angular.io/guide/docs-style-guide#alerts-and-callouts) section) and this just causes such headers to be wrongly rendered, as for example the [ModuleInjector one](https://angular.io/guide/hierarchical-dependency-injection#moduleinjector):

![Screenshot at 2022-06-05 17-49-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/172064263-3798b520-e2ff-44ed-9c18-3fb5b3fcfc13.png)


## What is the new behavior?

Such alerts have been converted to callouts so that the headers are not correctly rendered:

![Screenshot at 2022-06-05 19-02-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/172064343-c861b33c-e096-4464-b14a-eb1bb3c2dedb.png)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
 - this is exactly the same as #46145 , then I thought that was a one thing so I did not check for other occurrences, this time around I've run a regex search so hopefully I got all them all :slightly_smiling_face: 
 - I needed to remove the code tags from the headers since they were rendered quite awkwardly (with a very low color contrast):
![Screenshot at 2022-06-05 18-59-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/172064459-330123c2-5e27-4f78-96e5-60fcc586fbc8.png)
(I did that in a separate fixup commit, so if you disagree I can easily drop that one)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: change wrong alerts to callouts" (#46262)

Issues.Body:

### Description

In previous versions of angular I was able to remove undefined and null values from HttpParams Object in interceptor.
After upgrading to version 14 I am no longer able to remove them because all parameters are now converted to string.

Add exception for null and undefined values so it is possible to handle them in interceptor.

Issues.Title: Content projection for templates
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? core ### Description [Content projection](https://angular.io/guide/content-projection) is an amazing feature, but it [has no elegant support](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51948301/using-ng-content-in-ng-template/) for `ng-template`. Such feature exists in many other template engines ( [Twig](https://twig.symfony.com/doc/3.x/tags/macro.html), [Jinja2](https://docs-python.ru/packages/modul-jinja2-python/takoe-makrosy-shablonov-jinja2/), [Nunjucks](https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html#macro) etc.) and very handy, as makes templates bit less verbose and allow to follow the [DRY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don%27t_repeat_yourself) principle which increase overall productivity. Technically, such feature brings capability to operate with templates like with a [higher order functions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higher-order_function), and allow to reuse and compose them pretty simple. ### Proposed solution ### Option 1: `` component ```html World ! Hello ``` ### Option 2: `*ngTemplateOutletContent` directive ```html World ! Hello ``` ### Option 3: Both component and direcive Option 2 prevent appearing of component related nodes in DOM and makes it more clean, but Option 1 semantics looks great. So would be nice to have both on developer choice. ### Proof of concept Proof of concept on [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng-template-content?file=src%2Fmain.ts) for Angular 14. Proposed solution is based on top of [access to private fields](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng-template-content?file=src%2Fng-macro%2Fng-macro.directive.ts) (see `getMacroTemplateContext` function), so required implementation on core level. ### Alternatives considered Technically [feature](https://stackoverflow.com/a/56958107/1543705) already supported by core. But on practice: - Implementation is not obvious and straightforward; - Html markup too verbose and destroy sematic; This makes feature usage too complicated or even not possible. For sure, components itself do the stuff excellent. But for complex components create additional components just to decrease local markup complexity - it's just brings an additional complexity to the whole application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Content projection for templates" (#46269)

### Description

When use tg (Tajikistan) locale currency symbol should be '—Å–æ–º–æ–Ω”£' and number formatting with . for fraction part.
Example: 
Should be: 
11 111.98 —Å–æ–º–æ–Ω”£

I get : 
11 111,98 —Å–æ–º.

Also in russian and english locale symbol should be '—Å–æ–º–æ–Ω–∏' and 'somoni' from right side. But I get from left side. 

Russian locale currency TJS should be: 
11 111.98 —Å–æ–º–æ–Ω–∏
I get: 

11 111,98 TJS   (should be dot not comma)

English locale should be : 
11,111.98 somoni

But I get: 
TJS11,111.98

Issues.Title: Invalid `inject()` function typing
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

`inject()`'s type description seems to be invalid:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/5cfde8b23e72cff4c9359f765a462b474bb32631/packages/core/src/di/injector_compatibility.ts#L78-L80

Return type should be `T | null` only if flag is set to `InjectFlags.Optional` meaning that the signature should be something like this:

```typescript
 export function …µ…µinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>): T; 
 export function …µ…µinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>, flags?: InjectFlags.Default | InjectFlags...): T; 
 export function …µ…µinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>, flags?: InjectFlags.Optional): T | null; 
 export function …µ…µinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>, flags = InjectFlags.Default): T|null
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): improve resilience of logging during process exit
Issues.Body:
In certain situations the existing console logger created via `@angular-devkit/core` `createConsoleLogger`
could try to write to a closed stdout pipe stream. This would result in an error during
execution. For cases such as the completion script command, this would also prevent the
command from functioning. To mitigate these cases, `createConsoleLogger` is no longer used
and instead a logger instance is directly created within the CLI that uses `Console.log`
and `Console.error` to write output. Exiting the CLI also now waits for messages to be
logged before proceeding with the exit.

Fixes #23288
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): improve resilience of logging during process exit" (#23296)

Issues.Title: Angular 14 doesn't build library with multiple entry points
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli, compiler, upgrade

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Hi everyone,
I am about to migrate from v13 to v14, but I faced with the following issue. 
When I try to build library project it fails **on the first entry point which has reference to another entry** with the error:
```
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Building entry point 'xxx'
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
‚úñ Compiling with Angular sources in Ivy partial compilation mode.
PATH_TO_TS - error TS2305: Module '"yyy"' has no exported member 'xyz'.
```
But the thing is that everything is in place and it works fine with ng v13. Moreover `ng serve` is working fine, but not the build.

I created a repo for this issue, [main](https://github.com/mgameover/app-n-lib/tree/main) branch contains working version (ng v13) and [ng-14](https://github.com/mgameover/app-n-lib/tree/ng-14) branch has the same code after `ng update @angular/core@14 @angular/cli@14` with the issue.

**To reproduce the issue.**
1. Clone [main](https://github.com/mgameover/app-n-lib/tree/main) branch
2. Make sure that it builds the lib by running `npm run build-components` (ng build components)
3. Update angular to v14 by  running `ng update @angular/core@14 @angular/cli@14` 
4. Build component library `npm run build-components`

Result: failed to build

Any thoughts?

https://github.com/mgameover/app-n-lib/tree/ng-14

Issues.Title: Angular 14 build fails when importing css in source code from node modules
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, this worked in Angular 13.3.10 and prior Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... We are utilising 3rd party components Froala Editor and Fullcalendar where we import there css files in source code like the following - In the case of Froala we do the following ``` import 'froala-editor/css/plugins/draggable.css'; import 'froala-editor/css/plugins/table.css'; ``` In the case of Fullcalendar they may be doing inside their own component and the following issue has been added their repo - https://github.com/fullcalendar/fullcalendar/issues/6869 When running ng build you receive the following build error that look like the following - ``` ./node_modules/@fullcalendar/common/main.css:4:0 - Error: Module parse failed: Unexpected token (4:0) You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Exception or Error Error

# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, globally installing Angular CLI 13 worked with both Angular 13 and Angular 12 projects when running `ng test --watch=false`. ### Description Installing Angular CLI 14 globally and running `ng test --watch=false` on an Angular 13 or Angular 12 application results in the process never terminating. This causes CI builds to hang indefinitely on any step that runs Angular unit tests using this command. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - Run `npm i @angular/cli@13 -g` to Install Angular CLI 13. - Run `ng new` to create a new Angular application. Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): during an update only use package manager force option with npm 7+
Issues.Body:
The package manager `--force` option is only relevant to npm 7+ wherein the option controls
the strictness of the npm 7+ peer dependency resolution. Yarn 2+ does not support a `--force`
option. When the `ng update` `--force` option was used, `ng update` was incorrectly
applying the package manager `--force` option to Yarn which lead to an installation failure.
This has now been corrected and the package manager `--force` option is now only applied to npm 7+.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): during an update only use package manager force option with npm 7+" (#23285)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove unneeded TypeScript transforms with esbuild
Issues.Body:
Only the `replaceBootstrap` TypeScript transform is needed with the `browser-esbuild` builder.
The `replaceBootstrap` transform converts the default generated JIT bootstrap call into an AOT
bootstrap call within an application. The other transforms were used to remove the development
and JIT related metadata from the AOT compiler generated code. However, with the esbuild based
build pipeline, these will be automatically removed without the need for additional transforms
via the earlier usage of the `ngJitMode` and `ngDevMode` defines.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove unneeded TypeScript transforms with esbuild" (#23286)

Issues.Title: Avoid serving legacy JavaScript to modern browsers
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Using latest Angular 14, polyfills are injected in the DOM at the end of `</body>` with

```
<script src="polyfills.js" type="module">
```

next to all other JS.

We could improve performance by not loading those polyfills to modern browser at all. Lighthouse show this info in the report as well.

### Proposed solution

With `nomodule` in `<script>` we indicate ES2015+ browser to not load the polyfills at first. Legacy browsers on the contrary don't know this tag and load the `<script>` as usual.

More info: https://midzer.de/how-to-skip-loading-polyfills-in-modern-browsers

### Alternatives considered

Hmm, right now, I can't think of other options on how to to do it in a non-JS way.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Avoid serving legacy JavaScript to modern browsers" (#23287)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Typography): Defining a Level
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

In the [Typography Guide](https://material.angular.io/guide/typography) there's this section.

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-config Sass function. This function accepts, in order, CSS values for font-size, line-height, font-weight, font-family, and letter-spacing. You can also specify the parameters by name, as demonstrated in the example below.

@use '@angular/material' as mat;

$my-custom-level: mat.define-typography-level(
  $font-family: Roboto,
  $font-weight: 400,
  $font-size: 1rem,
  $line-height: 1,
  $letter-spacing: normal,
);
```

Instead of.:

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-config Sass function. 
```

It should be

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-level Sass function. ```
```

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/typography
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Typography): Defining a Level" (#25030)

Issues.Title: feat(GoogleMap): Expose map for use with other apis
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I have a map loaded on my screen, but I also want to use the Places Api. Although geocoding is supported by the library, places is not.

The map, and map instance, are created solely through my template
```
        <google-map [options]="options" class="col-sm-8">
            <map-marker
                [options]="markerOptions"
                [position]="markerPosition"
            ></map-marker>
        </google-map>
```

I have been trying the following code

```
        const map1: any = document.querySelector("google-map") as unknown;
        console.log("lookup", map1)

        const map2: GoogleMap = map1;
        var request = {
            query: 'albina',
            fields: ['name', 'geometry'],
        };
        var service = new google.maps.places.PlacesService(map2);
        service.findPlaceFromQuery(request, (results, status) => console.log(results, status))
```

This works in javascript - the querySelector returns the dom node, but it can be passed successfully to `PlacesService`. As I am using typescript I keep being told that I can't pass an html element (not withstanding my attempts to override the type).

Really what I want is to access the map as is, rather than using dom lookups, but I cannot work out how to access that. As you can see, I am able to create and pass options to the component, but don't know angular well enough to get the map back


### Use Case

I also want to use the Places Api which requires me to pass a google map. the obvious candidate is the one created by this component, but I cannot see how to access it
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(GoogleMap): Expose map for use with other apis" (#25026)

Issues.Title: bug(Datepicker): Hidden calendar button not in the selected language
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was



### Description

When the locale changes for the datepicker, the calendar switch to the appropriate language. But the hidden 'Close calendar' button stay in english. This is an issue for accessibility, especially for reader application.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106828605/171902517-d7db98f8-daf5-4fad-a594-7e7a7bd7412d.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Change locale to French
2. Open the Datepicker
3. Press 'TAB' until the hidden button appear


### Expected Behavior

The label and content of the button should be in the language specified by the locale.

### Actual Behavior

The hidden button stay in english

### Environment

- Angular: 11+
- CDK/Material: Datepicker
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Datepicker): Hidden calendar button not in the selected language" (#25021)

Issues.Title: bug(GoogleMap): map is greyed when running in an Ionic Mobile App on ios device
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

in my Ionic 6 application running under capacitor, i'm using angular googleMaps component. I need to use this map component in several pages of my application.

In my browser, everything works fine. When i run the app on my IOS physical device, the map is correctly displayed in the first page. But, when i navigate to **other page** with the same googleMap component, the map is displayed greyed out. When i touch the map, the grey disappears and the map is correctly displayed.

In Google Cloud Console, i resticted the API key to some http urls ( not to an IOS app because of ionic ) but this does not solve the issue.

Do you have any ideas ?

Thanks

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. run the ionic App on physical IOS device
2. check the google map component


### Expected Behavior

the map is correctly displayed

### Actual Behavior

the map is greyed out when running on physical IOS device

### Environment

- Angular: 12
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s): IOS Device
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(GoogleMap): map is greyed when running in an Ionic Mobile App on ios device" (#25011)

Issues.Title: bug(MatDialog): Mouse press outside of dialog enables backwards navigation and interacting outside of the dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When a dialog is displayed I expect that the user should not be able to interact with the UI behind the dialog. But this is possible by using the keyboard while the mouse is pressed down.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview
2. Open a dialog in any of the examples
3. Press down left mouse button outside of the dialog (keep it pressed down)
4. Press shift + tab

### Expected Behavior

It navigates in the dialog.

### Actual Behavior

It navigates outside of the dialog.
As long as the mouse is pressed down the user will be able to continue navigating and even interact with elements behind the dialog

### Environment

- Angular: 13.3.8
- CDK/Material: 13.3.8
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatDialog): Mouse press outside of dialog enables backwards navigation and interacting outside of the dialog" (#25009)

Issues.Title: bug(MatListModule): Jest failed "ReferenceError: Cannot access 'MatListBase' before initialization"
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12.1.1

### Description

```
   ReferenceError: Cannot access 'MatListBase' before initialization

       9 | } from '@angular/core';
      10 | import { MatDialog } from '@angular/material-experimental/mdc-dialog';
    > 11 | import { MatListOption, MatSelectionList } from '@angular/material-experimental/mdc-list';
         | ^
      12 | import { Router } from '@angular/router';
      13 |
      14 | import {

      at Object.<anonymous> (../../node_modules/@angular/material-experimental/fesm2020/mdc-list.mjs:343:190)
```

Other modules work as expected. We're using both angular/material and angular/material-experimental in our project and only MatListModule related components failed in test. 

MatListModule
MatListOption
MatSelectionList

Similar to Issue #23907 except we're using material-experimental.









### Reproduction

Import `MatListModule`, `MatListOption` or `MatSelectionList` to your component or module then run the tests.

### Expected Behavior

 I guess expected behavior is that Angular partial compilation emit should be work properly as I've paraphrased it from the comment below  

https://github.com/angular/components/issues/23907#issuecomment-961896720

### Actual Behavior

```
  ReferenceError: Cannot access 'MatListBase' before initialization

      1 | import { ComponentFixture, TestBed } from '@angular/core/testing';
      2 | import { MAT_DIALOG_DATA } from '@angular/material-experimental/mdc-dialog';
    > 3 | import { MatListModule } from '@angular/material-experimental/mdc-list';
        | ^
      4 |

      at Object.<anonymous> (../../node_modules/@angular/material-experimental/fesm2020/mdc-list.mjs:343:190)

```

### Environment

- Angular: 13.3.10
- CDK/Material:13.3.8
- Material Experimental : 13.3.8
- Operating System: macOS

- Jest : 28.1.0
- jest-preset-angular : 12.0.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatListModule): Jest failed "ReferenceError: Cannot access 'MatListBase' before initialization"" (#25008)

Issues.Title: @michaelfaith Yeah, this is related to the Angular partial compilation emit not properly dealing with `forwardRef` and our APF v13 package output therefore emitting invalid Angular declarations for JIT. Once this is fixed upstream, we'll republish a version, and we'll have better testing for ensuring JIT linker-processing works. See #23882
Issues.Body:
@michaelfaith Yeah, this is related to the Angular partial compilation emit not properly dealing with `forwardRef` and our APF v13 package output therefore emitting invalid Angular declarations for JIT. Once this is fixed upstream, we'll republish a version, and we'll have better testing for ensuring JIT linker-processing works. See #23882

_Originally posted by @devversion in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/23907#issuecomment-961896720_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@michaelfaith Yeah, this is related to the Angular partial compilation emit not properly dealing with `forwardRef` and our APF v13 package output therefore emitting invalid Angular declarations for JIT. Once this is fixed upstream, we'll republish a version, and we'll have better testing for ensuring JIT linker-processing works. See #23882" (#25007)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): add `BaseMatDatepickerIntl` abstract class
Issues.Body:
Add the `BaseMatDatepickerIntl` abstract class. It is the same as
`MatDatepickerIntl`, except that all members that require translations
are abstract. This gives clients a way to verify that they have provided
translations for every member that needs it and did not leave any out.
